Posts.Content: Hi  Dreamthief  Thanks,,,,that is the same dose as me so I think the GP has made a mistake,,,,,,,will check at the Hospital as I'm going for treatment   Cheers
Posts.Title: Repeat prescriptions from GP

Posts.Content: I ordered my first repeat online from my GP yesterday and noticed he had doubled the dose of Adcal-D3, In fact I'm not sure if the dose has been doubled as I can't read the original prescription,,,,,,,,,but the one I got from the Oncologist say's ONE A DAY and the GP say's take TWO A DAY,,,,,,,,, Anyone come across this ??? Cheers
Posts.Title: Repeat prescriptions from GP

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy, I could have written that  post ! I have three more treatments left and I'm already worrying about where else the cancer is going to turn up ! I was fortunate in so far as I only had a lumpectomy with clear margins but I feel  the problem here is dealing with the psychology of being diagnosed I truely feel we have been changed forever and cancer will alway's be at the back of our minds! My focus now is taking on board all the advice that was given to me, improving my immune system by avoiding dairy, red meat and as far as possible only eating organic,,,,,,,,,not forgetting exercise, I also avoid sugar and alcohol ! I start the day with a freshly squeesed  lemon in warm water to kick start my body, that makes me feel in charge from the moment I get up,,,,,,,,,,may sound silly to a lot of people but it works for me, It is my way of being in control and doing my bit to ensure cancer will have a lesser chance of getting  a grip on me again,,,,,, I feel totally exhausted come the afternoon so any form of exercise must take place in the morning's and that can be mopping floors, cleaning window's,,,,,,,,,it does not matter as long as I am moving ! I wish you well in overcoming all the fears, God knows it's not an easy road for any of us and at such a young age as yourself it must be so much harder........ I'm sure you will have a very long life ahead of you, there are so many survivers out there living full lives so just focus on being one of them :-) Thanks to the poster's that recommended the book I will get it on  my Kindle today ! A long and healthy life is wished for all of us !
Posts.Title: Finding the uncertainty unbearable at times

Posts.Content: Just read Rio Ferdinand's wife died of breast cancer,,,,,,,,,,,,I'm stunned,,,,,,,,,how could that have happened so quick ????
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Think it was the "short  battle with cancer" that spooked me,,,,,however looks like she had it for some time ???? but kept quiet about it,,,,,,,,,,,,,, none the less so very sad when a young Mum passes away, Of course it will frighten the life out of women that have been just diagnosed,,,,,,,,,,so very important now to remind newbies coming on here that a huge amount survive breast cancer and it's getting better all the time,,,,,,,,, xxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Hi Crystal Kitty, I do feel a trip to you're GP would help you,,,,,,,,,also I think all of us overreact to any symptoms after having Cancer,,,,,,,,,,I know I do and many times have convinced myself that it has come back,,,,,,,,, Like you I got the all clear but I do get my down day's and feel really worried about everything,,,,,,,,, So a chat to you're GP will at least get the ball rolling and hopefully reassure you Cancer changes us forever in my opinion and I'm really suffering with the side effects of treatment atm,,,,,,,,,,but hey ho a small price to pay  I feel Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Well I won't be watching that programme, I think it would have a very negative effect on me,,,,,,, I was upset too at hearing about Rio Ferdinand's  wife,,,,,,,,so young and so quick,,,,,,,,,,anyone know what type of cancer it was???
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Well with all this talk of Rhubarb I'm off into the garden to pick some and make a crumble ,,,,,with lashing's of homemade custard,,,,,,,,,,,,,will fight the battle of the bulge tomorrow :-/
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Glad I'm not alone with anxiety feeling's for the first year Mammogram ! brought it all back to me and was afraid to open the letter when it came through, I did view my Mammogram scans as soon as they were done just to reassure myself, silly thing to do really as I don't have the educated eye, however I did not see the pea sized white spot so relaxed a little, Also as it had gone unnoticed in my 2011 scan I wanted to make sure there was nothing being missed if a negative result came through ! Long life and good health to all of us :-)
Posts.Title: Relieved after results

Posts.Content: Trees, Hope you're Mum got sorted,,,,,,,,that really is a terrible story !
Posts.Title: lumpectomy and severe swelling

Posts.Content: I'm recently diagnosed and having my Lumpectomy on Tuesday, My Consultant told me to avoid dairy and eat organic, just reading up on it now and I agree with your post and I will look into Jane Plant, So pleased to have discovered this forum !
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hi Monika, Please may I have the Facebook link you mention  Thanks
Posts.Title: DAIRY FOODS HIT BREAST CANCER RECOVERY

Posts.Content: Hi Valerie-anne  I too endorse the advice on walking, I was told by my Surgeon do do this every day and power walk in spurts, Unfortunally I have had to stop due to joint pain but will work to regaining this pleasure again, Walking is a great way to stay fit and  reduce weight gain and can be done when it suits you so have a go and see how you are after a month :-) Carriek I too would like to join a walking group but lack confidence as I may not be as fit as those already in,,,,,I will have to look into it, thanks for the prompt A long and healthy life to all of us :-)
Posts.Title: weight gain on hormone therapy

Posts.Content: Kentstar, I could have written that,,,,,,,,,,,,,I come form a very large family and watched 97% all pass away with cancer,,,,,,,,,,,all in mid life,,,,,,,,,yes genitics  will play a huge part but also think lifestyle must trigger something off I do think there will be an answer one day......... Good wishes to all
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Well I've just spent the morning reading this blog so not a dish washed :-( Chloecat45, I hope you continue posting and all works out for you, you have the advantage of being able to understand all the medical jargon which no doubt helps you to ask informed questions and enabling you to understand the answers,,,,,,,,,, however most of us don't  and remain at the mercy of the medics and the Internet, which I no longer browse, just sticking with the main Cancer ones' now ! hairworries,,,, glad to see you here, you were a great help to me when I first came on here and asked some question's Maybe I can help you with you're question on how we get cancer,,,,,,,,,just what my MM nurse said to me regarding Alcohol ,,,,,,,,,,,,, and that is the researcher's are now  leaning toward's Alcohol as being ONE of the causes in starting it off, certainly made me feel I will stay well clear of it! Also it must lower our immune system so just makes sense to me to either stay away from it or only drink in moderation, Building up the immune system is key as it put's us in control,,,,,,,,,,,I am very aware there are many very clean living people out there who have lost their lives to cancer so at the end of the day think we still have some way to go but with cancer increasing year on year what we are eating and drinking must be playing a huge part, I do avoid dairy, red meat and sugar's and stick to organic as much as possible, however I very recently started eating Free Range Chicken as I could not justify the cost of organic,  Had I lassoed a sparrow in the garden and roasted it there would have been more meat on it ! Good health and a long and happy life to us all :-)
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: aily Mail Online @MailOnline · 3h3 hours ago Breast cancer patients may be spared chemo thanks to new tests http://dailym.ai/1GvtblW
Posts.Title: Interesting news
